intro: Cicerbita thianschanica, commonly known as the Tian Shan cicerbita, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly the Tian Shan range. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
